title: POS and online card payment failures, declines and duplicate charges
body_text: For complaints about POS or online card payments that failed, were declined, or resulted in duplicate charges, the agent must first confirm whether an authorization and financial posting exist in the card system. If no authorization record is found, the failure is typically on the merchant or network side; the customer should be asked to retry with a different terminal or channel. Where a financial posting exists but the customer did not receive goods or services, a formal dispute must be raised in the card_disputes_chargebacks queue in line with scheme rules. For duplicate card charges or incorrect amounts, supporting evidence such as receipts, screenshots or merchant communication should be collected. The customer must receive a dispute reference number and clear timelines for temporary credit, investigation and final resolution.

title: Unauthorized card transactions and card lost or stolen
body_text: If a customer reports unauthorized card transactions or confirms that a card is lost or stolen, the agent must immediately block the card and cancel any active digital wallet tokens. The customer’s recent activity should be reviewed to identify the disputed transactions and channels. A fraud case must be logged in the fraud_investigations queue with full transaction details, dates, and channels. Where network or scheme rules allow, provisional credit may be granted subject to investigation outcomes. The agent must clearly advise the customer not to share PINs, CVV, passwords or OTPs and arrange a replacement card. All actions should comply with regulatory reporting and internal suspicious activity escalation standards.

title: Handling proactive fraud monitoring alerts and customer confirmations
body_text: Fraud monitoring systems may trigger alerts for unusual or high-risk card and wallet transactions. When the fraud_monitoring team contacts a customer, the agent must perform full identity verification before discussing any transaction details. If the customer confirms that transactions are legitimate, blocks may be removed in line with risk rules. If the customer denies transactions, the card must be blocked and a fraud case created for fraud_investigations. Documentation of customer responses, risk decisions and any changes to limits or channels must be captured in the monitoring system for audit and regulatory reporting.

title: ATM cash not dispensed or ATM out of service with debited account
body_text: For ATM complaints where cash was not dispensed or the ATM was out of service but the account was debited, the agent must confirm the ATM ID, date, time and amount. The atm_pos_operations team should check host and switch logs to determine whether the transaction was reversed automatically. If no reversal is visible within the standard SLA (commonly 24–48 hours), a formal ATM dispute must be registered and monitored. The customer must be provided with a complaint reference number and clear timelines for provisional and final credit. Any goodwill refunds or manual adjustments must follow delegated authority and be recorded in the core account notes.

title: Login, password reset, biometric and app stability issues
body_text: For digital banking login problems, password reset issues or app crashes, the agent must first verify customer identity using approved KYC checks. The digital_banking_support team should confirm whether the profile is locked due to multiple failed attempts, whether credentials are expired, and whether the customer is using a supported app version and device. Password resets and biometric re-enrolment must follow secure procedures and never involve sharing full passwords or OTPs with staff. Repeated session timeouts or crashes should be logged with device type, OS version and timestamps and escalated to core_banking_it_support if systemic. Any incident affecting multiple customers must be flagged as a major incident according to ITIL processes.

title: MFA OTP failures, push notifications and device linking issues
body_text: When customers cannot receive OTPs or push notifications, or face device linking and card tokenization failures, the agent must validate registered contact details and verify that the customer’s device and app meet security requirements. The cybersecurity_and_access_management team should check for telecom outages, spam filtering, and any security blocks on the profile. Device binding or token activation may need to be reset following strong customer authentication. Security controls must not be bypassed simply to complete a transaction; any exception requires documented approval. All events that may indicate compromised contact details or devices must be escalated according to the bank’s security incident procedures.

title: Domestic transfers, UPI failures, refunds and standing order issues
body_text: For domestic payment and UPI issues, the agent must confirm the transaction reference, date, amount and beneficiary details. The domestic_payments_operations team should verify the transaction status in payment gateways and core systems. If a payment failed before leaving the bank, any debited amount must be reversed within the published SLA. If the transaction reached the beneficiary bank but the customer claims non-receipt, interbank dispute procedures must be followed using the official reference (UTR or equivalent). Standing orders, employer mandates and direct debits should be checked for correct setup, expiry and sufficient funds. Customers must be given realistic timelines for resolution and guidance on how to avoid repeat failures.

title: International transfer delays and overseas account usage issues
body_text: When customers complain about delayed or failed international transfers, the agent must obtain the transfer reference, currency, destination country and expected beneficiary. The international_payments_operations team should review SWIFT or equivalent messages, compliance holds and correspondent bank statuses. Delays due to sanctions, AML screening or missing beneficiary information must be clearly explained, while respecting confidentiality rules. For overseas card or account usage issues, the team should verify whether international usage is enabled and whether any country or merchant category blocks apply. Customers should be informed of indicative timelines, potential charges and required documentation.

title: Balance discrepancies, deposits, withdrawals and profile updates
body_text: For balance discrepancy and deposit or withdrawal complaints, the agent must reconcile ledger and available balances, and review recent transactions including card authorizations and pending items. The retail_account_operations team should verify cash, cheque and electronic deposits against branch and channel logs. Profile updates such as address, contact details and account ownership changes must be supported by valid documentation and processed under dual control. Statement requests should be fulfilled through official channels only, ensuring that delivery addresses and email IDs are verified. Any manual adjustments to balances or ownership require appropriate approvals and must be fully documented.

title: Closure of current, savings and salary accounts
body_text: When customers request closure of current, savings or salary accounts, the agent must check for outstanding balances, un-cleared items, active standing orders, direct debits and linked loan or card obligations. The retail_account_operations team should confirm that regulatory retention and KYC requirements are met before closure. Any residual credit balance must be refunded via approved methods, and confirmation of closure should be provided to the customer. Complaints about forced closures or unexpected restrictions must be logged and escalated to complaints_and_escalations_office where appropriate.

title: Fee and interest disputes including annual fees and minimum balance charges
body_text: For complaints about annual card fees, minimum balance charges and overdraft interest, the agent must validate the charge against the current tariff and any waiver flags recorded on the customer’s profile. The retail_account_operations team should recalculate interest where needed and confirm whether fees were triggered by valid events such as low balances or overdraft utilization. Where the bank is at fault or as a one-time goodwill gesture, refunds may be processed within delegated limits. Repeat complaints or systemic misunderstandings about fees should be escalated to the complaints_and_escalations_office for review of product design and customer communication.

title: Overdraft activation, limit changes and cancellation requests
body_text: For overdraft-related requests, the agent must confirm the sanctioned limit, review recent credit assessments and check whether all documentation is in place. Overdraft_activation_issue and overdraft_limit_issue cases should be routed to retail_account_operations with supporting credit decisions. Cancellation requests must ensure that outstanding overdrawn amounts are regularized and that any linked facilities are updated. Changes to overdraft limits must always be supported by documented approval in line with credit risk policy, and customers must be informed of new pricing and conditions in writing.

title: Fixed deposit auto-renewal, maturity payout and rate issues
body_text: For fixed deposit complaints, the agent must review the original booking details, maturity instructions and interest rate in the core system. Auto-renewal issues require checking whether payout instructions were properly captured. Maturity payout and premature withdrawal complaints must be assessed against published FD terms, including penalties and revised interest. Rate mismatch queries should be resolved by comparing the contracted rate on the booking date with the tariff table. All adjustments, including goodwill waivers, must be documented and supported by appropriate approvals.

title: Loan repayment issues, EMI changes and closures (personal and auto loans)
body_text: For personal and auto loan repayment issues, the agent must confirm the contractual EMI amount, due date and repayment method. The retail_loans_servicing team should verify incoming payments, salary assignments and direct debit mandates. EMI change requests and prepayment inquiries must be handled according to loan policy, including recalculation of amortization schedules and any penalties. Loan closure requests require full settlement of outstanding amounts and issuance of closure letters or NOCs. All changes to repayment terms must be documented and approved under credit governance.

title: Auto loan documentation, insurance and registration requirements
body_text: For auto loans, the auto_loans_servicing team must ensure that all documentation, including vehicle invoices, insurance policies and registration proof, is obtained and validated. Complaints about delays in disbursement or approval require review of underwriting decisions, valuation reports and pending documentation. Customers should receive a clear checklist of requirements and an estimated timeline for completion. Any exceptions to standard documentation must be approved and recorded in the loan file to maintain auditability.

title: Mortgage loan servicing, property valuation and closure
body_text: Mortgage servicing involves complex documentation and valuation steps. For repayment complaints, the mortgage_servicing team must verify EMI schedules, rate types and any recent changes in interest rates. Delays in approval or disbursement are often related to pending property valuations or legal checks; customers must be kept informed of progress and required actions. Prepayment and full settlement requests must follow policy on penalties, lock-in periods and re-calculation of interest. On closure, all security documents and mortgages must be released in line with regulatory requirements.

title: Business and corporate account operations and mandates
body_text: For business and corporate accounts, operations must ensure correct handling of mandates, signing authorities and bulk payment instructions. Complaints about blocked or frozen accounts require quick verification of KYC, sanction or legal holds. Balance and transaction disputes must be reconciled against high-volume payment and collection files. Standing orders and direct debits should reflect corporate mandates and cut-off times. Any exception to standard processes must be agreed with relationship managers and documented thoroughly.

title: Card delivery, activation, PIN and limit issues
body_text: For card lifecycle issues, contact center agents should verify delivery status with courier or branch logs and confirm card activation and PIN generation in the system. Card_authorizations manages limit-related issues and cash advance restrictions, ensuring that changes comply with credit policy and customer consent. Credit limit increase requests must be assessed based on income, repayment history and internal scoring. PIN changes and re-issuance must follow secure authentication procedures and never involve disclosure of full PINs over the phone.

title: General information, product features and insurance requirements
body_text: The contact_center_general queue handles routine questions about product features, eligibility, pricing, statement availability and insurance requirements. Agents must rely on the latest approved product and tariff information and avoid making verbal commitments that deviate from policy. For insurance-related requirements, customers should be referred to official brochures or terms and conditions. Where queries require specialist input, the case should be transferred or warm-handed to the relevant operations or relationship teams.

title: Core banking and channel technical incidents
body_text: Core_banking_it_support is responsible for diagnosing and resolving system-level issues impacting balances, postings and channel availability. When multiple customers report similar errors, the incident should be recorded with clear impact, start time and affected channels. Workarounds and customer communication must be agreed with business owners and, where appropriate, published as service advisories. Once resolved, root cause analysis and permanent fixes should be documented to prevent recurrence.

title: Formal complaints, regulatory timelines and escalations
body_text: All formal complaints and escalation requests must be logged in the complaints management system with full details of the issue, customer impact and previous handling. The complaints_and_escalations_office monitors adherence to regulatory response timelines and ensures that customers receive clear written outcomes. Complex cases such as repeated fee disputes, loan hardship and unresolved fraud are reviewed for root cause, systemic risk and potential remediation. Where service failures are identified, process improvements and staff training should be initiated.

title: Overdue credit card payments and collections handling
body_text: Card_collections manages overdue credit card balances, payment arrangements and hardship cases. When customers complain about calls or reminders, agents must check delinquency status, recent payments and any existing arrangements. Genuine hardship cases should be routed for assessment under the bank’s restructuring or relief programs, while ensuring that regulatory and internal guidelines on forbearance are followed. All commitments agreed with customers must be recorded and monitored for adherence.
